messages.title: Working for Wales
messages.content: Ensuring Wales has the same powers and funding per head as Scotland.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Ensure an additional £1.2 billion for Wales each year and 1,000 extra doctors in Wales to reduce waiting times.
Create 50,000 sustainable jobs by giving public contracts to local firms.
Deliver deeper cuts in the public sector; protect jobs and services.
Increase the minimum wage to the living wage and create a pay rise for 250,000 Welsh workers.
Cancel tuition fees for students studying science, technology, engineering, or mathematics.

mentions.candidate: Boyd Hackley-Green is already working hard for Torfaen.
mentions.partyLeader: Leanne Wood, Arweinydd/Leader of Plaid Cymru

issues.economy: Create 50,000 sustainable jobs by giving public contracts to local firms.
issues.education: Cancel tuition fees for students studying science, technology, engineering, or mathematics.
issues.governance: Deliver deeper cuts in the public sector; protect jobs and services.
issues.health: Ensure an additional £1.2 billion for Wales each year and 1,000 extra doctors in Wales to reduce waiting times.
issues.socialWelfare: Increase the minimum wage to the living wage: a pay rise for 250,000 Welsh workers.

contactInformation.address: Freepost, Plaid Cymru, The Party of Wales, Parklands, New Hen-Blas, Parklands, New Hen-Blas, Newport, NP18 2XS

endorsements.endorser: Leanne Wood, Arweinydd/Leader of Plaid Cymru
endorsements.endorsement: Boyd is already working hard for Torfaen. I hope you support Plaid Cymru to ensure your family and your community has a strong voice in Westminster.

quotes.text: Boyd is already working hard for Torfaen. I hope you support Plaid Cymru to ensure your family and your community has a strong voice in Westminster.
quotes.source: Leanne Wood, Arweinydd/Leader of Plaid Cymru
